SENT.plain: We present the case of a patient with dilated ischemic cardiomyopathy and severe mitral regurgitation
Due to several comorbidities, he underwent percutaneous transvenous mitral annuloplasty
Postoperatively, he complained of atypical chest pain
He was treated for pericarditis and died suddenly 10 days after the procedure
Autopsy showed distal perforation of the anterior interventricular vein with migration of the device on the diaphragm
